greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of column sequences with a certain o.g.f. pattern.
comment: The column o.g.f.s of this triangle appear as factors in the column o.g.f.s of triangle A008517 (second-order Eulerian numbers).
formula: G.f. column k: G(k, x):= x^(k-1)/product((1-j*x)^(k-j+1), j=1..k), k>=1.
The column sequences start with A000012 (powers of 1), A000295 (Eulerian numbers), A112502-A112504.
a(n+k-1, k)=sum of product(binomial(n_j + k - 1, k - 1)*j^(n_j), j=1..k) with sum(n_j, j=1..k)=n, n_j >=0. There are binomial(n+k-1, k-1) terms of this sum and 1<=k<=n+1. a(n, k)=0 if n+1<k.
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Oct 14 2005
